advice: always identify yourself and any others with you
ask if the person requires assistance and listen for specific instructions

do: use HTML tags corresponding their functions
use ARIA labels to guide screen readers
use the ARIA dialog role on your popups/dropdowns
add descriptive alt tags to images
do_not: avoid autoplay media: they might confuse the person, and they would not be able to switch them off
avoid stacking popups or other additional content: it confuses screen readers

behaviour_patterns: highly likely using a screen reader
relies more on hearing rather than vision
name: vision impairment

do: use different shapes/icons to mark different options rather than only rely on different colours
do_not: avoid using colours from the green-red axis against each other: for this person, they look the same

behaviour_patterns: can tell apart blue and yellow
description: decreased ability to see colour/differences in colour
name: dichromacy

advice: allow more time and greater flexibility for training and induction
provide clear and thorough explanations and instructions
minimise stress to maximise concentration and performance
give verbal and written instructions or try giving examples to illustrate ideas and summarise ideas

do: keep a minimum of items on page
do_not: avoid unreasonable distractions alias bright decor or flashing buttons

description: a type of brain damage that occurs after birth. The injury may occur because of infection, disease, lack of oxygen or a trauma to the head.
name: acquired brain injury
